channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: 2023 Brisbane Open House
item.description:
Sunday, July 16, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Orange to support 2023 Brisbane Open House.

Brisbane Open House is a free public access event. It allows the public to gain access to buildings and spaces, that they usually wouldn't have access to. It is building Brisbane's cultural capital.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Open House

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: Gambling Harm Awareness Week
item.description:
Monday, July 17, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Green to support Gambling Harm Awareness Week.

Gambling Harm Awareness Week is an annual event in Queensland that aims to increase awareness of gambling harms, safer gambling practices and the help available to the people affected by gambling problems. If gambling has become a problem for you, or someone you care about, get some help. It’s free and confidential.

This Light Up is organised by: Relationships Australia Qld

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Good Luck Matildas!
item.description:
Tuesday, July 18, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Green and Gold to support the Australian Matildas in the 2023 FIFA Women’s World Cup.

The FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023 is the biggest women’s sporting event in the world, and it’s happening right here on Australian soil! The USA are the defending World champions, and will be looking for their fifth World Title, but they will have some mighty opposition. In preparation for this we wish the Matilda’s all the best of luck as they kick off the tournament against Ireland in the opening sell out match.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: International AIDS Society and HIV Science
item.description:
Wednesday, July 19, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support International Aids Society and HIV Science.

International AIDS Society convenes, educates and advocates for a world in which HIV no longer presents a threat to public health and individual well-being.

The IAS 2023, being held at the Brisbane Convention and Exhibition Centre, will shine a spotlight on the world's advances in HIV research, and is the world’s most influential meeting on HIV research and its applications. This biennial conference presents the critical advances in basic, clinical and operational HIV research that move science into policy and practice. Through its open and inclusive programme, the meeting sets the gold standard of HIV science, featuring highly diverse and cutting-edge research.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of National Pyjama Day
item.description:
Thursday, July 20, 2023

City Hall will be lit Blue, Pink and White to support eve of National Pyjama Day.

National Pyjama Day is all about wearing your favourite pair of PJ’s to help The Pyjama Foundation raise much needed awareness and funds for children in foster care.

The Pyjama Foundation supports the educational outcomes for children in foster care through the Love of Learning Program. Volunteers, known as Pyjama Angels, spend time with children in care once a week reading books aloud, playing educational games and engaging in fun learning-based activities. Most importantly, a Pyjama Angels role is to provide consistent friendship and support for the child, teaching them that they are valued.

This Light Up is organised by: The Pyjama Foundation Ltd

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup
item.description:
Thursday, July 20, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink, Green, White, Orange, Light Blue and Yellow to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup.

From 20 July to 20 August, Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia will co-host the FIFA Women’s World Cup. This will be the first time that the tournament will be co-hosted across two countries and Brisbane/Meaajin is proud to be one of the nine Host Cities.

As well as hosting matches, a Fan Festival™ in Brisbane/Meaanjin will take place at the South Bank Parklands, offering the perfect place to watch live FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches and enjoy an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.  

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Belgian National Day
item.description:
Friday, July 21, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Black, Yellow and Red to recognise Belgian National Day.

The Queensland Consulate of Belgium would like to welcome the Queensland community to join with them to celebrate the Belgium National Day, on July 21. This commemorates the day on which Leopold I took the constitutional oath as the first King of Belgium, on July 21st 1831.

This Light Up is organised by: The Queensland Consulte of Belgium

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Brisbane French Festival
item.description:
Friday, July 21, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to celebrate Brisbane French Festival.

After a 3-year break, Le Festival is returning – to a new location: Victoria Park/Barrambin on July 21st– 23rd. Brisbane is invited to a ‘magnifique’ experience ‘a la française’ enjoying French and French-inspired exhibitors at the French Market and Artists & Artisans’ tent, food, Champagne, with entertainment and live performances. Put on your béret, style your stripes, bring your baguette, channel your chic… and be a part of Le Festival 2023!

This Light Up is organised by: Le Festival

item.title: 2023 World Fragile X Day
item.description:
Saturday, July 22, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Orange to support 2023 World Fragile X Day.

Fragile X Association of Australian is a registered charity providing support, information, and education to people with Fragile X syndrome and their families/carers. (Fragile X syndrome is the leading cause of inherited intellectual disability and a single-gene cause of autism). We are a national, member-based organisation. Our mission is to improve the lives of individuals affected by Fragile X. We have been operating for around 33 years. We have members, and Board members, in all states. World Fragile X Day raises awareness of Fragile X syndrome and promotes understanding, acceptance and inclusion of people with Fragile X and, more broadly, all people with intellectual disability. 2023 marks the 8th year of our "light up" campaign; Brisbane was the first city to embrace Fragile X Awareness Day in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Fragile X Association of Australia

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: 9 years to Brisbane 2032 Olympics
item.description:
Saturday, July 22, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit in the Olympic Colours to celebrate 9 years to the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games.

To celebrate this milestone, over the weekend of Saturday 22 and Sunday 23 July 2023, residents and visitors will have the opportunity to experience the Rings and Agitos in iconic Brisbane locations and meet Olympians and Paralympians.

Celebrations will culminate in a spectacular drone show on Saturday night 22 July that will light up the Brisbane skyline above the Story Bridge and Brisbane River. The show will include 500 environmentally-efficient drones illuminating the Rings and Agitos in the night sky.

The drone show will commence at approximately 7pm and run for around 12 minutes.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council



Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

The show will include 500 environmentally-efficient drones illuminating the Rings and Agitos in the night sky. The drone show will commence at approximately 7pm and run for around 12 minutes. item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup
item.description:
Saturday, July 22, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink, Green, White, Orange, Light Blue and Yellow to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup.

From 20 July to 20 August, Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia will co-host the FIFA Women’s World Cup. This will be the first time that the tournament will be co-hosted across two countries and Brisbane/Meaajin is proud to be one of the nine Host Cities.

As well as hosting matches, a Fan Festival™ in Brisbane/Meaanjin will take place at the South Bank Parklands, offering the perfect place to watch live FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches and enjoy an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.  

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Donate Life Week
item.description:
Sunday, July 23, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Magenta to support Donate Life Week.

DonateLife Queensland aims to save the lives of the 1800 Australians on the transplant waitlist by coordinating organ and tissue retrieval throughout Queensland hospitals. The annual national DonateLife Week campaign raises awareness on the need to register as an organ and tissue donor on the Australian Organ Donor Register.

item.title: International AIDS Society and HIV Science
item.description:
Monday, July 24, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support International Aids Society and HIV Science.

International AIDS Society convenes, educates and advocates for a world in which HIV no longer presents a threat to public health and individual well-being.

The IAS 2023, being held at the Brisbane Convention and Exhibition Centre, will shine a spotlight on the world's advances in HIV research, and is the world’s most influential meeting on HIV research and its applications. This biennial conference presents the critical advances in basic, clinical and operational HIV research that move science into policy and practice. Through its open and inclusive programme, the meeting sets the gold standard of HIV science, featuring highly diverse and cutting-edge research.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.description:
Tuesday, July 25, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support World Drowning Prevention Day.

World Drowning Prevention Day invites stakeholders – irrespective of the sector they represent – to take one concrete action to advance drowning prevention, something all of us can do – at any level and at any time. This year's theme is "Do one thing to prevent drowning” and will help Royal Life Saving achieve it's objectives.
Royal Life Saving Queensland is focused on reducing drowning and promoting healthy, active and skilled communities through innovative, reliable, evidence based advocacy.

item.description:
Thursday, July 27, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Pink, Green, White, Light Blue, Orange and Yellow, alternating with Green and Gold to celebrate Australia playing Nigeria in the FIFA Women's World Cup.

item.description:
Friday, July 28, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to recognise the 202nd Independence Day of Peru.

July 28 marks the 202nd Independence Day of Peru. The Honorary Consulate of Peru aims to bring Peruvian residents in Brisbane and Gold Coast together and share their culture with the Australian community.

This Light Up is organised by: Consul of Peru

item.title: Strive To Be Kind Day
item.description:
Friday, July 28, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Yellow to support Strive To Be Kind Day.

The Allison Baden-Clay Foundation aims to reduce the incidents of family and domestic violence through education programs in the community, schools and corporates. The Foundation was established following the murder of Allison in 2012, and Strive To Be Kind Day brings about awareness and raises funds for the elimination of domestic abuse and coercive control. It also celebrates Allison's life as her family and friends share the Strive To Be Kind Day lunch in Brisbane each year. The state is encouraged to wear yellow, buy a sunflower and perform a random act of kindness.

This Light Up is organised by: Allison Baden Clay Foundation

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup
item.description:
Saturday, July 29, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink, Green, White, Orange, Light Blue and Yellow to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup.

From 20 July to 20 August, Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia will co-host the FIFA Women’s World Cup. This will be the first time that the tournament will be co-hosted across two countries and Brisbane/Meaajin is proud to be one of the nine Host Cities.

As well as hosting matches, a Fan Festival™ in Brisbane/Meaanjin will take place at the South Bank Parklands, offering the perfect place to watch live FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches and enjoy an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.  

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Small Steps 4 Hannah Gala
item.description:
Saturday, July 29, 2023

City Hall will be lit Pink to celebrate the Small Steps 4 Hannah Gala taking place in City Hall.

Small Steps 4 Hannah Gala In their quest to honour Hannah, Aaliyah, Laianah and Trey and ensure that no family should endure this pain again, the Clarke family have started a movement for change ‘Small Steps 4 Hannah’ to put a HALT to the incidences and severity of domestic and family violence in Australia.

Our Gala Ball is to fundraise to support the rollout of our new Educational Program "HALT" Program in the schools. This is to teach healthy and respectful relationships for all children at a young age. We also give funds to smaller grass roots DFV charities who do not receive Government Funding.

This Light Up is organised by: Small Steps 4 Hannah



Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

Our Gala Ball is to fundraise to support the rollout of our new Educational Program "HALT" Program in the schools. This is to teach healthy and respectful relationships for all children at a young age. We also give funds to smaller grass roots DFV charities who do not receive Government Funding. This Light Up is organised by: Small Steps 4 Hannah

item.title: 2023 World Hepatitis Day
item.description:
Sunday, July 30, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to support 2023 World Hepatitis Day.

Hepatitis Queensland is a community based, non-government organisation that represents the interests of people affected by, or at risk of viral hepatitis. We support the community with holistic, proactive and innovative responses to provide better liver health for all Queenslanders. World Hepatitis Day (WHD) 2022 is an annual awareness day celebrated across the globe and throughout Australia. WHD seeks to raise awareness for those affected by or at risk of viral hepatitis as we work towards the global target of eliminating viral hepatitis by 2030.

This Light Up is organised by: Hepatitis QLD

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

Hepatitis Queensland is a community based, non-government organisation that represents the interests of people affected by, or at risk of viral hepatitis. We support the community with holistic, proactive and innovative responses to provide better liver health for all Queenslanders. World Hepatitis Day (WHD) 2022 is an annual awareness day celebrated across the globe and throughout Australia. WHD seeks to raise awareness for those affected by or at risk of viral hepatitis as we work towards the global target of eliminating viral hepatitis by 2030.

This Light Up is organised by: Hepatitis QLD

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup
item.description:
Monday, July 31, 2023

City Hall will be lit Pink, Green, White, Orange, Light Blue and Yellow to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup.

From 20 July to 20 August, Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia will co-host the FIFA Women’s World Cup. This will be the first time that the tournament will be co-hosted across two countries and Brisbane/Meaajin is proud to be one of the nine Host Cities.

As well as hosting matches, a Fan Festival™ in Brisbane/Meaanjin will take place at the South Bank Parklands, offering the perfect place to watch live FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches and enjoy an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.  

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
